column1: Little Delving was a village of the Shire. It is situated to the north-east of the Westfarthing
column2: perhaps north to its bigger counterpart
column3: Michel Delving.; a road leading off to the northwest is marked "To Little Delving".

column1: The name represents a possible Old English form Lytel Delfing. It means "small digging".

column2: towns and villages of the Shire
